ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] twisting 5, added note
ygData.msgSnippet: Besides... twisting 5-8 songs isn t complicated, it s button mashing with, at best dubious, results. Twisting in quotes, because that isn t twisting.  Talies,
ygData.messageBody:
Besides..."twisting" 5-8 songs isn't complicated, it's button mashing with,
at best dubious, results.

Twisting in quotes, because that isn't twisting. Talies, I don't have the
FAQ handy, so I don't know if you defined twisting, but I propose it be
added, if the majority here agree. That way, we can ridicule bard twinks
who claim to be able to twist with a document to back us up. :) There's
that rogue side of me...hey, who else thinks bards should get a limited
backstab ability?? :)

On an unrelated note, I've seen Briliana online lately...you still lurking
here? :) /wave

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 19, 2002 10:08 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] twisting 5, added note


Hope youre wife actaully LIKES you telling ...errr... showing her how to
play.
I think for someone who picks on everyone else's overgeneralizations that
you're making a pretty big one there yourself, Kaz.

-----Original Message-----
From: KAZ [mailto:kazvorpal@...]
Sent: Monday, February 18, 2002 7:25 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] twisting 5, added note


--- John Grady <john_grady@...> wrote:
> I agree Atonal. I mean Kaz, if it was as easy and beneficial as you
> describe don't you think a lot
> of Bards would be doing it? There's a lot of people on this list that have
> played them for 2+
> years and while very few of us may be "hard-core" gamers, the majority of
> us can key mash with the
> best of 'em.

No, because too many of the gamers don't have enough sense to do things more
complicated than what occurred to them at random when they started. My wife
